s: ^I'm doing okay, but I came over to check on you. You look... stressed.
^Hi, Elisa! That's quite some pile of notes... whatcha studying?

Chat1: ^Elisa?Neutral "Oh, it's probably nothing. I mean, not nothing, but it will be okay."
^Elisa?Neutral "Gosh, that sounds worse than it is. My mom got bloodwork yesterday and I'm a little worried about her."

s: ^Do you want to talk about it?
^That's rough. Is there any way I can help?

Chat2: ^Elisa?Neutral "I don't know. I'm starting by doing my research, and figuring out how much to worry. I think it's worse right now because I'm getting ready to move away for part of the year."

s: ^Worrying is natural. Do you think I might be able to help?

QuestIntro: ^Elisa?Smiling "Well, since you asked, how much do you know about diabetes? I want to know as much as I can, so I can support my mom with her diagnosis."
^Elisa?Neutral "I've been reading medical websites - like the CDC and the Mayo Clinc and watching YouTube shows about diabetic cooking."
^Elisa?Neutral "Just... everything I could find about being diagnosed and the lifestyle changes that come with."

s: ^Hmmm, I may be able to help. Can you tell me more?
^Would it help if I asked around for more information?

QuestDetails1: ^Elisa?Neutral "What I know is that her bloodwork came back this year, and her doctor wants her to go to an endocrinologist. Type 2 diabetes."
^Elisa?Neutral "Her A1C is high. Evidently that's a long-term measure of your blood sugar."

s: ^I'm going to go ask questions and come back to you!

QuestDetails2: ^Elisa?Neutral "I guess her test results have been "borderline" for some time, but not enough to cause anyone to worry. Now she's in the range that could cause other health concerns."
^Elisa?Neutral "I didn't know it was something to worry about until now."

s: ^Got it! I think I can find someone with more knowledge.

QuestAcceptance: ^Elisa?Smiling "That would be a real relief. I just know this is going to be stressful for my folks once the whole thing sinks in."
^Elisa?Smiling "I didn't think to ask around - I just dove right into the books. If you can cover the people side, that's twice the ground. I really appreciate the help."

s: ^Of course, Elisa! You can always count on me.

Goodbye: ^Elisa?Smiling "I would love to have resources to share when they're ready,
